definition: (physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The principle of equivalence is of critical importance in our analysis of inertial navigation .
sentences.chinese: 等效原理在惯性导航分析中特别重要。

sentences.english: Inertia scalars are defined in terms of quantities called inertia vectors.
sentences.chinese: 我们将用惯性矢量来定义惯性标量。

sentences.english: Inertia scalars are defined in terms of quantities called inertia vectors.
sentences.chinese: 我们将用惯性矢量来定义惯性标量。

sentences.english: So apparently the passivity the inertia can be explained.
sentences.chinese: 这么一来惯性的被动状态就能说得通了。

sentences.english: An engineering approach to the determination of the inertia properties of the fuel in external tanks is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了外挂副油箱中油液惯性特性的工程处理方法。

sentences.english: This article presents professor Cai Gan's experience in the treatment of senile habitual constipation.
sentences.chinese: 介绍蔡淦教授治疗老年习惯性便秘的经验。

sentences.english: The mathematic model describing shift and synchronizing process was established.
sentences.chinese: 建立了惯性式同步器接合过程数学模型。

sentences.english: He was routinely likened to Cromwell.
sentences.chinese: 人们习惯性地把他与克伦威尔作比。

sentences.english: We start with Newton's Second Law, at first referring our problem to an inertial frame.
sentences.chinese: 我们从牛顿第二定律出发，并且先只涉及惯性系。

sentences.english: Inertia carried the car to the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 惯性使汽车驶到了人行道上。

sentences.english: A dynamic model of landing gear struts is introduced in a non-inertial coordinate system.
sentences.chinese: 在非惯性坐标系中建立了起落架支柱的动力学模型。

sentences.english: Customarily, I spent the weekends at my aunt Badri's.
sentences.chinese: 我还总是习惯性的在巴德丽姨妈家过周末。

sentences.english: These analyses are useful for the design of the inertia separation chamber.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果可为惯性沉降分离室的设计提供参考。

sentences.english: Both the inertance and capacitance effects are time-dependence .
sentences.chinese: 惯性和容量的效应都是随时间而变化的。

sentences.english: Symbols are signs that refer to the object by a convention.
sentences.chinese: 标志是一种人们习惯性指代某种事物的符号。

sentences.english: The other arose out of the habitual activity of the park’s users.
sentences.chinese: 另一组是由逛公园的人们的习惯性活动踩踏出来的。

definition: to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi
to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
upward/up/to advance/to try to improve oneself/to make progress
to reduce speed/to slow down/to take it easy
